title: Revaluation Q
content: I just checked my ESA papers today by paying 100 rs each (sem 1). How does the revaluation process work? If I put my paper for revaluation by paying 1000 rs, does the whole paper get rechecked or do I have to select certain Qs which I want them to re-evaluate? Also can marks reduce during reval?

comments.body: The whole paper gets rechecked. Yes your marks theoretically can decrease but I have personally never seen anyone whose grade dipped. Also, important point to note is that your grade needs to change - if your grade remains the same, the reval won't be refunded.
Will the existing grade be shown to the Revaluator
In revaluation the whole paper is checked by a single teacher, so they can see your marks.
